Join our Westchester Community    Students enjoy a close-knit group of Westchester working professionals, as well as access to the Langone network in Manhattan                  Build Possible    Langone Part-time MBA student Mark Alex Maidique, AIA, applies concepts from Stern classes in Westchester to his local kitchen and cabinetry design business.                  Connect Possible    The Part-time MBA kicks off with Langone Lab, where you'll connect with classmates and professors, collaborate in study groups, sign up for clubs, and learn to turn challenges into opportunities                  Lead Possible    Strengthen your leadership skills in the Langone Student Government, where you'll have the opportunity to spark change within the Stern community.                  An Education in Possible    Stern offers its top-ranked Langone MBA for Working Professionals in Purchase, NY                  Take Action       Attend an Event    Visit a Class    Apply    Check Your Application Status               Request Information      Sign Up                 Announcements          Apply now to learn your decision by August 1 if you submit a complete application by the May 15 deadline     Learn about the Westchester/Fairfield Alumni Scholarship for 2015-2016 incoming Westchester students      Follow NYU Stern and Dean Peter Henry on Twitter                   The Langone MBA for Working Professionals in Westchester      Learn more about Stern's Langone MBA in Westchester from students and alumni             NYU Stern Westchester is accessible from:          Westchester, Putnam, Rockland and Bronx Counties, NY     Fairfield County, CT     Bergen County, NJ                   Virtual Tour      Take a virtual tour of NYU Stern Westchester                                                                                                                                 News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N. Deadlines & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   FAQs     Meet With Us Contact a Student   Videos   Hours of Operation   Directions                                      The Langone MBA for Working Professionals is top-ranked and customizable.                  ACCELERATE POSSIBLE    Our Accelerated Two-Year option lets you complete your MBA in just two years while working. Gabby Martinez earned her degree in two years while working as an Account Manager at Hulu.                  CONNECT POSSIBLE    The Part-time MBA kicks off with Langone Lab, where you'll connect with classmates and professors, collaborate in study groups, sign up for clubs, and learn to turn challenges into opportunities                  SEE POSSIBLE    Langone MBA student Yaopeng Zhou joined with MBA alum Marc Albanese to create a portable eye exam tool for the developing world, winning a Verizon Powerful Answers award                  EXPAND POSSIBLE    Langone MBA student and entrepreneur Jon Katz leveraged his education to launch a new venture.                  Take Action       Attend an Event    Apply    Check Your Application Status               Request Information      Sign Up                 Announcements          Apply now to learn your decision by August 1 if you submit a complete application by the May 15 deadline     Merit based scholarships available     Read the Langone Student Blog for first-hand stories about our MBA program      Follow NYU Stern and Dean Peter Henry on Twitter                   About the Langone MBA       Learn more about the Langone MBA for Working Professionals from students and alumni             Manhattan Program Options    Weeknights    Saturday    Accelerated Two-Year      Quick Links    Class Profile    Application Deadlines    Tips for Financing your MBA    Virtual Tour             Instagram: Scenes from @NYUStern                                                                                                                                     News      NYU Stern Center for Business and Human Rights to Tackle Migrant Labor Rights in the Construction Industry    Foreign Policy Association Awards Medal to Dean Peter Henry    Follow @NYUStern on Twitter and like NYU Stern on Facebook         Basics      Directions & Maps    Faculty Directory    Contact Us                                 FACULTY OPINIONS    Read Stern faculty opinions on  relevant business topics             Sitemap | Privacy | © 2015 Leonard N.
